questions.question: What are the key components in commercial 1,3-diene polymerization catalysts mentioned in the text?
Which divalent rare-earth-metal complexes are reported to display the first structurally characterized homoleptic metal tetraisobutylaluminates?
What reaction gives access to SmII/SmIII mixed-valence cluster [Sm6Cl8(AliBu4)6]?
Which binary system fabricates polyisoprene in a perfectly living manner?
What is the result of the reaction of [Ln(AliBu4)2] (Ln = Sm, Yb) with oxidizing chlorido donors?
questions.answer: Formation of SmII/SmIII mixed-valence cluster [Sm6Cl8(AliBu4)6] and the YbII cluster [Yb4Cl4(AliBu4)4]

questions.question: What are the catalytically active species scrutinized by NMR spectroscopy in the context of isoprene polymerization?
Why might the [Yb(AliBu4)2]/[HNPhMe2][B(C6F5)4] system perform living polymerization perfectly?
questions.answer: Due to the specific interaction between the Yb complex and the borate, leading to a stable catalytically active species

questions.question: How does the structural feature of η3-coordination in isobutylaluminates influence their reactivity?
questions.answer: The η3-coordination provides a unique structural motif that may enhance solubility and reactivity in polymerization processes

questions.question: What role does the treatment with B(C6F5)3 play in the formation of arene-coordinated hydroborates?
questions.answer: B(C6F5)3 acts as a strongly Lewis-acidic borane, leading to hydride abstraction and the formation of arene-coordinated hydroborates

questions.question: Why do the LnII tetraalkylaluminate complexes with a discrete monomeric structural motif show excellent solubility?
questions.answer: The discrete monomeric structure and the nature of the isobutyl groups contribute to the solubility in both aliphatic and aromatic solvents

questions.question: How does the presence of η6-arene coordination in complexes indicate the electron-deficiency of rare-earth-metal centers?
questions.answer: η6-Arene coordination stabilizes electron-deficient metal centers by providing additional electron density through arene-metal interactions

questions.question: The only crystallographically characterized lanthanide compound featuring a tetraisobutylaluminato moiety was obtained by Evans et al.
The synthesis of the corresponding methyl- and ethylaluminates [Ln(AlR4)2]n (Ln = Sm, Eu, Yb; R = Me, Et) has not been described before.
Isostructural [Ln(AlEt4)2]n feature agostically linked right-handed helices composed of ethyl-bridged building units.
The reaction of [Ln(AliBu4)2] (Ln = Sm, Yb) with oxidizing chlorido donors always results in the formation of trivalent lanthanide complexes.
The binary system [Yb(AliBu4)2]/[HNPhMe2][B(C6F5)4] is incapable of performing living polymerization.
The LnII centers in isostructural 1Ln complexes are 6-coordinate due to the η3-coordination of the tetraisobutylaluminato ligands.
Treatment of [Ln(AliBu4)2] with C2Cl6 does not give access to any mixed-valence cluster.
